member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.BackupOperations.Client
member.summary: Gets a reference to the Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.RecoveryServicesBackupManagementClient.

The Trigger Backup Operation starts an operation in the service which triggers the backup of the specified item in the specified container in your Recovery Services Vault. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call Get Protected Item Operation Result API.
member.param: Required. Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Request header parameters.
Optional. Fabric name of the protected item.
Optional. Name of the container where the protected item belongs to.
Optional. Name of the protected item which has to be backed up.
Optional. Backup request for the backup item.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.IBackupOperations
member.summary: The Resource Manager API includes operations for triggering and managing the backups of items protected by your Recovery Services Vault.

The Trigger Backup Operation starts an operation in the service which triggers the backup of the specified item in the specified container in your Recovery Services Vault. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call Get Protected Item Operation Result API.
member.param: Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Name of your recovery services vault.
Request header parameters.
Fabric name of the protected item.
Name of the container where the protected item belongs to.
Name of the protected item which has to be backed up.
Backup request for the backup item.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.IProtectedItemOperations
member.summary: The Resource Manager API includes operations for managing the items protected by your Recovery Services Vault.

The Create Or Update Protected Item Operation is used to enable protection of an item within a container or to modify the protection of an already protected item. In the case of enable protection, this operation creates a new protected item entity in the backend service. In the case of modify protection, this operation updates the already created entity in the backend service. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call the Get Item Operation Result API.
member.param: Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Name of your recovery services vault.
Fabric name of the protected item.
Name of the container where the protected item belongs to.
Name of the protected item which has to be backed up.
Request header parameters.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.IProtectedItemOperations.DeleteProtectedItemAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.Models.CustomRequestHeaders,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: The Delete Protected Item Operation is used to disable protection of an item within a container. This operation marks the already existing protected item entity as not protected in the backend service. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call the Get Item Operation Result API.
member.param: Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Name of your recovery services vault.
Fabric name of the protected item.
Name of the container where the protected item belongs to.
Name of the protected item which has to be backed up.
Request header parameters.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.

member.summary: Gets Info for the given item present in the given container specified by the names passed in the arguments. member.param: Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Name of your recovery services vault.
Request header parameters.
Cancellation token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.IRecoveryServicesBackupManagementClient.GetDeleteOperationResultAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.Models.CustomRequestHeaders,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Once you trigger a delete operation such as deleting a protected item etc., you may use this method to get the operation's result. Once the operation has started, the status code in the response would be Accepted. It will continue to be in this state till it reaches completetion. On successful completion, the status code will be OK. This method expects the ID of the operation to be passed in the arguments. This usually is part of the Location header of the operation response.
member.param: Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Name of your recovery services vault.
Request header parameters.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Response object returned by the get operation result APIs.

member.summary: Once you trigger a delete operation such as deleting a protected item etc., you may use this method to get the operation's result. Once the operation has started, the status code in the response would be Accepted. It will continue to be in this state till it reaches completetion. On successful completion, the status code will be OK. This method expects the tracking URL of the operation to be passed in the arguments. This usually is the Location header of the operation response.
member.param: Location value returned by operation.

member.summary: The GetOperationStatusByURL method can be used to fetch the status of an operation such as triggering a backup, restore etc. The status can be in progress, completed or failed. You can refer to the Operation Status enum for all the possible states of the operation. Some operations may create jobs within the backend service. This method can return the list of jobs when the operation is complete.
member.param: Location value returned by operation.
Request header parameters.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Response of the get operation status API calls.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.IRestoreOperations
member.summary: The Resource Manager API includes operations for triggering and managing restore actions of the items protected by your Recovery Services Vault.

The Trigger Restore Operation starts an operation in the service which triggers the restore of the specified item in the specified container in your Recovery Services Vault based on the specified recovery point ID. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call Get Protected Item Operation Result API.
member.param: Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Name of your recovery services vault.
Request header parameters.
Fabric name of the protected item.
Name of the container where the protected item belongs to.
Name of the protected item whose recovery points are to be fetched.
ID of the recovery point whose details are to be fetched.
Restore request for the backup item.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.ProtectedItemOperations
member.summary: The Resource Manager API includes operations for managing the items protected by your Recovery Services Vault.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.ProtectedItemOperations.#ctor(Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.RecoveryServicesBackupManagementClient)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ProtectedItemOperations class.
member.param: Reference to the service client.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.ProtectedItemOperations.Client
member.summary: Gets a reference to the Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.RecoveryServicesBackupManagementClient.

The Create Or Update Protected Item Operation is used to enable protection of an item within a container or to modify the protection of an already protected item. In the case of enable protection, this operation creates a new protected item entity in the backend service. In the case of modify protection, this operation updates the already created entity in the backend service. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call the Get Item Operation Result API.
member.param: Required. Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Fabric name of the protected item.
Required. Name of the container where the protected item belongs to.
Required. Name of the protected item which has to be backed up.
Required.
Optional. Request header parameters.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.

member.summary: The Delete Protected Item Operation is used to disable protection of an item within a container. This operation marks the already existing protected item entity as not protected in the backend service. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call the Get Item Operation Result API.
member.param: Required. Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Fabric name of the protected item.
Required. Name of the container where the protected item belongs to.
Required. Name of the protected item which has to be backed up.
Required. Request header parameters.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.

member.summary: Once you trigger a delete operation such as deleting a protected item etc., you may use this method to get the operation's result. Once the operation has started, the status code in the response would be Accepted. It will continue to be in this state till it reaches completetion. On successful completion, the status code will be OK. This method expects the ID of the operation to be passed in the arguments. This usually is part of the Location header of the operation response.
member.param: Required. Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Name of your recovery services vault.
Required.
Optional. Request header parameters.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Response object returned by the get operation result APIs.

member.summary: The GetOperationStatusByURL method can be used to fetch the status of an operation such as triggering a backup, restore etc. The status can be in progress, completed or failed. You can refer to the Operation Status enum for all the possible states of the operation. Some operations may create jobs within the backend service. This method can return the list of jobs when the operation is complete.
member.param: Required. Location value returned by operation.
Optional. Request header parameters.
Cancellation token.

member.summary: Gets a reference to the Microsoft.Azure.Management.RecoveryServices.Backup.RecoveryServicesBackupManagementClient.

The Trigger Restore Operation starts an operation in the service which triggers the restore of the specified item in the specified container in your Recovery Services Vault based on the specified recovery point ID. This is an asynchronous operation. To determine whether the backend service has finished processing the request, call Get Protected Item Operation Result API.
member.param: Required. Resource group name of your recovery services vault.
Required. Name of your recovery services vault.
Optional. Request header parameters.
Optional. Fabric name of the protected item.
Optional. Name of the container where the protected item belongs to.
Optional. Name of the protected item whose recovery points are to be fetched.
Optional. ID of the recovery point whose details are to be fetched.
Optional. Restore request for the backup item.
Cancellation token.
member.returns: Base recovery job response for all the asynchronous operations.
